com.asm.text

Class TextData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.asm.text.TextData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable, android.text.Editable, android.text.GetChars, android.text.Spannable, android.text.Spanned, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.CharSequence
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CursorTextData, HighlightTextData

    public class TextData
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.text.Editable, android.os.Parcelable, java.io.Serializable
    Storage text and highlight data for ScrollingEditText. Supports editing, drawing utilities, undo/redo, and cache. I REALLY worked hard for this...
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • openUndoActions

        public void openUndoActions()
        Open the undo actions. Used when undo mode is UndoManager.UNDO_MODE_OPENED and if there is any opened Actions, close it and open new Actions.

      • closeUndoActions

      • openUndoActionsTemporary

        public void openUndoActionsTemporary()
        Open the undo actions if current undo mode marks actions.
        See Also:
        this#openUndoActions()

      • closeUndoActionsTemporary

        public void closeUndoActionsTemporary()
        Close the actions if when called openUndoActionsTemporary() opened the actions and restore to last mode.

      • disableUndo

        public int disableUndo()
        Used when temporary disable undo mode.

      • enableUndo

        public void enableUndo()
        Used when current mode is UNDO_MODE_DISABLED or called disableUndo(); this re-enables undo mode. For instance, when mode is a and called disableUndo() and later called this method, actions between calling disableUndo() and calling this will be not marked on undo history.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if undo mode is not disabled

      • undoMode

        public int undoMode(int mode)
        Set the undo / redo stack mode. If mode set to UNDO_MODE_OFF, all history will be destroyed.

      • setEncoding

        public void setEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
        Set the encoding. This does not convert the text encoding; just set the code encoding. If you want to convert the text encoding, use convertEncoding(String).

      • convertEncoding

        public void convertEncoding(java.lang.String newEncoding)
        Convert the encoding to new encoding. Currently not developed.

      • getEncoding

        public java.lang.String getEncoding()
        Return the encoding. This method doesn't ensure which thia text was written in that encoding. It might set by this#setEncoding.

      • setText

        public void setText(TextData other)
        Set the text data from other data. If other has parent or not, parent will not be changed. Also update the caches.

      • getLinePosition

        public int getLinePosition(int lines)
        Returns the position of the line and col 0. You should make sure that first line is line 0.
        Parameters:
        lines - line number that want to get position
        Returns:
        the index start from first character, or return -1 when failed.

      • getLinePosition

        public int getLinePosition(int lines,
                           int startPos,
                           int startLine)
        Returns the position of the line and col 0.
        Parameters:
        lines - line number that want to get position
        startPos - start position that measure lines.
        startLine - start line index that start to search. Start from 0.
        Returns:
        the index start from first character, or return -1 when failed.

      • onInsert

        protected boolean onInsert(int where,
                           java.lang.CharSequence text,
                           int start,
                           int end)
        Overridable function for insert(). When you override this method, calling super.onInsert() will actually deletes the texts and calls onTextChanged(). And, before this method called, beforeTextChanged() was called, and after returns, onTextChanged() and afterTextChanged() will called.

        You should call super if you not want to not changing texts because all the event on the insert will be called.

        Returns:
        whether actually text was changed

      • lightSubSequence

        public java.lang.CharSequence lightSubSequence(int start,
                                               int end)
        Lightly return the CharSequence. Different to subSequence(), this task is very fast and not use much memory. But if TextData's text was changed, lightly SubSequenced text will be also changed.

      • onReplace

        protected boolean onReplace(int st,
                            int en,
                            java.lang.CharSequence text,
                            int start,
                            int end)
        Overridable function for replace(). When you override this method, calling super.onReplace() will actually replaces the texts and calls onTextChanged(). And, before this method called, beforeTextChanged() was called, and after returns, onTextChanged() and afterTextChanged() will called.

        You should call super if you not want to not changing texts because all the event on the replace will be called.

      • onDelete

        protected boolean onDelete(int start,
                           int end)
        Overridable function for delete(). When you override this method, calling super.onDelete() will actually deletes the texts and calls onTextChanged(). And, before this method called, beforeTextChanged() was called, and after returns, onTextChanged() and afterTextChanged() will called.

        You should call super if you not want to not changing texts because all the event on the delete will be called.

      • wrapFromDataStream

        public static TextData wrapFromDataStream(java.lang.Object data,
                                          TextDraw parent)
        Initialize TextData from a serialized-object. When you got the TextData object from ObjectInputStream or other, you should initialize that object by this object.
        Parameters:
        data - what you want to convert
